content.title: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme - Magel Tyala Shettale (Individual Farm Pond)
content.department: Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, Dairy Development & Fisheries Department
content.details: Chief Minister Sustainable Agriculture Irrigation Scheme-Magel Tyala Shettale (Individual Farm Pond) has been launched by Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, Dairy Development & Fisheries Department, Maharashtra State in the year 2022-23 (vide G.R.Dated 29th June, 2022). Under this scheme, subsidy payable to individual farmer is minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond. The scheme is implemented in all districts of the state.
benefits: Financial Assistance is given to farmers.
The subsidy payable to an individual farmer minimum Rs.14433/- and maximum Rs.75000/- depending on the size of the farm pond.
eligibility: Farmer should hold at least (Minimum) 0.20 ha. land in Kokan region, while it is 0.40 ha. limit for rest of Maharashtra.
The applicant farmers land will have to be technically suitable for digging farm pond.
Before applying for farm pond, the applicant farmers should not have availed the subsidy for farm pond, community tank or bodi in paddy bunding or any Government Scheme.
exclusions: Farmers who have availed the subsidy for farm pond, community tank or bodi in paddy bunding under any Government Scheme previously is not eligible for subsidy again.

faqs.question: What are the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Financial Assistance up to certain limit is given to farmer for construction of individual farm pond.

faqs.question: How much Financial Assistance is given to farmer under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme the subsidy payable to an individual farmer is minimum Rs. 14433/- and maximum Rs. 75000/- depending on the size of farm pond.

faqs.question: How the Subsidy will be disbursed?
faqs.answer: Subsidy will be disbursed through aadhaar link Bank account.

faqs.question: If there is joint land holder can the benefit of the scheme be availed?
faqs.answer: In case of joint land holding, land demarcation map must be available, if not the benefit cannot be given to the individual farmer.

faqs.question: What if the farmer has land less than 0.20 ha. in Kokan area or less than 0.40 ha. in rest of Maharashtra area?
faqs.answer: Farmers application will be rejected and not eligible, so can't be benefited.
